title: algebra-formula
description: math algebra formula from basic to advanched
author: Phoenix Admission Care

dataSet.title: real-numbers
dataSet: Two positive integers are called co-prime numbers if and only if they have 1 as their only common factor and thus HCF(x, y) = 1.
An irrational number is a real number that cannot be expressed as a ratio of integers; for example, √2 & √3 are irrational number.
Adding 1 to the product of any four consecutive natural numbers makes the sum a whole square number.

dataSet.title: set
dataSet: (A – B) = A if A ∩ B = Ø
n(A ∪ B) = n(A) + n(B) – n(A ∩ B)
n(A ∪ B) = n(A – B) + n(B – A) + n(A ∩ B)
n(A ∪ B ∪ C) = n(A) + n(B) + n(C) – n(A ∩ B) – n(B ∩ C) – n(C ∩ A) + n(A ∩ B ∩ C)

n(A ∪ B ∪ C) = n(All A) + n(All B) + n(All C) - n(`exactly two`) - 2×n(all three) + n(neither)
Previously, n(A) = n(only A). Here, n(All A) = All A which are also common in others. `exactly two` = common in any two only
A Δ B = (A - B) ∪ (B - A); where Δ = `symmetric difference`

**Problem: Out of 50 People, 35 people speak in English and 25 people speak both Bangla and English and everybody speaks at least one language.**
1. How many people speak in Bangla? **Ans:** 40
2. Hoe many people speak in only Bangla? **Ans:** 15
3. How many people speak in English? **Ans:** 35
4. How many people speak in only English? **Ans:** 10
5. How many people speak in at least one language? **Ans:** 25

**In class of 120 students, 60% can speak French and the rest speak only English. If 25% of French speaker can also speak English, how many can speak English?
Ans:** 55% = 66

dataSet.title: inequality
dataSet: If | x | ≤ a, then – a ≤ x ≤ a
If | x | ≥ a, then – a ≥ x ≥ a
If a ∈ R, then | a | ≥ a
If a ∈ R, then | a | ≥ - a
If a ∈ R, then | - a | = | a |
If a ∈ R, then | a |$^2$ = a$^2$ or | a | = $\sqrt{a^2}$
If a, b ∈ R, then | ab | = | a | | b |
